posts.title: No Man Is An Island
posts.content: No man is an island,&#10Entire of itself,&#10Every man is a piece of the continent,&#10A part of the main.&#10If a clod be washed away by the sea,&#10Europe is the less.&#10As well as if a promontory were.&#10As well as if a manor of thy friend’s&#10Or of thine own were:&#10Any man’s death diminishes me,&#10Because I am involved in mankind,&#10And therefore never send to know for whom the bell tolls;&#10It tolls for thee.

posts.title: Stopping by Woods On a Snowy Evening
posts.content: Whose woods these are I think I know.&#10His house is in the village though;&#10He will not see me stopping here&#10To watch his woods fill up with snow.&#10My little horse must think it queer&#10To stop without a farmhouse near&#10Between the woods and frozen lake&#10The darkest evening of the year.&#10He gives his harness bells a shake&#10To ask if there is some mistake.&#10The only other sound’s the sweep&#10Of easy wind and downy flake.&#10The woods are lovely, dark and deep,&#10But I have promises to keep,&#10And miles to go before I sleep,&#10And miles to go before I sleep.

posts.title: Still I Rise
posts.content: You may write me down in history&#10With your bitter, twisted lies,&#10You may tread me in the very dirt&#10But still, like dust, I’ll rise.&#10Does my sassiness upset you?&#10Why are you beset with gloom?&#10’Cause I walk like I’ve got oil wells&#10Pumping in my living room.&#10Just like moons and like suns,&#10With the certainty of tides,&#10Just like hopes springing high,&#10Still I’ll rise.&#10Did you want to see me broken?&#10Bowed head and lowered eyes?&#10Shoulders falling down like teardrops.&#10Weakened by my soulful cries.&#10Does my haughtiness offend you?&#10Don’t you take it awful hard&#10’Cause I laugh like I’ve got gold mines&#10Diggin’ in my own back yard.&#10You may shoot me with your words,&#10You may cut me with your eyes,&#10You may kill me with your hatefulness,&#10But still, like air, I’ll rise.&#10Does my sexiness upset you?&#10Does it come as a surprise&#10That I dance like I’ve got diamonds&#10At the meeting of my thighs?&#10Out of the huts of history’s shame&#10I rise&#10Up from a past that’s rooted in pain&#10I rise&#10I’m a black ocean, leaping and wide,&#10Welling and swelling I bear in the tide.&#10Leaving behind nights of terror and fear&#10I rise&#10Into a daybreak that’s wondrously clear&#10I rise&#10Bringing the gifts that my ancestors gave,&#10I am the dream and the hope of the slave.&#10I rise&#10I rise&#10I rise.
